item.title: 【UPSCALED】Mélys - November (2024) [4K AI Upscale | HEVC 10-bit | PCM]
item.description:
Genre: Indie, Folk
Year: 2024
Video Source: YouTube, 1440p
Audio Source: Qobuz (CD quality)
Lyrics: Apple Music, thanks SonMaxime

"November" is a song by French Indie-Folk band / singer-songwriter Mélys, co-written by Safran Lecuivre and Mélys and released on March 21, 2024.
- "November is the desire to get out of the city, to breathe fresh air, the desire to be alone, in silence, facing the sea. Running away from gray walls and squeaky noises. Leave the crowds to find yourself face to face with the moon."

From the Greek “bee” and the Welsh “sweet”, Mélys Bouvier's first name gave name to her music which she describes as Floral Folk. Originally from Pézenas, she started by learning the violin at the Béziers conservatory, then discovered the guitar to better reveal to us today her love of music, instilled since she was very young by her mother and grandfather. Nature is at the center of her work, the one where she grew up in France and that of dozens of other regions of the world that she explored during her early adult life. After three years of traveling in Latin America and the Caribbean by sail and hitchhiking, a guitar in one hand and a violin in the other, she finally returned to the family hamlet in the south of France, rediscovering the vineyards, the river, her beloved nature. It was there that she composed her first EP Agua. Navigating between English and Spanish, her soft, raspy voice time reminds us of those lost moments when our mind wanders and lets itself be carried away by melancholy. Mélys said that in her music we find a blues of Norah Jones, the colors of Lhasa, a vibrato of Alice Phoebe Lou and the melancholy of Debussy. - Main source: Press Kit, March 2024

The music video for November, directed by Safran Lecuivre, was released together with the song.

Release Info
The video track is upscaled from 1440p to 4K with Topaz Video AI, encoded to HEVC 10-bit.
The PCM track is lossless (Qobuz 16-bit 44.1 kHz) and synced with Adobe Audition.
The timed lyrics are created from scratch. Enable the subtitles to see the lyrics.
